# Question 2

## Asymptotic approach AMISE






## Exact approach MISE

\begin{align}
f(x; \mu, \sigma, \boldsymbol{w}) = \sum_{j = 1}^{r} w_{j}\phi_{\sigma_{j}}(x - \mu_{j})
\end{align}

where $w_{j} \geq 0$, $j = 1,...,r$ and $\sum_{j=1}^{r} w_{j} = 1$


If $f$ is given by the equation (1) and the kernel $K$ is distributed $N(0,1)$ then:

\begin{align}
MISE_{r}[\hat{f}(\cdot;h)] = {(2\sqrt{\pi}nh)}^{-1} + \boldsymbol{w}^{'}\{(1 - n^{-1})\Omega_{2} - \Omega_{1} + \Omega_{0}\}\boldsymbol{w}
\end{align}

with $(\Omega_{a})_{i,j} = \phi_{{(ah^{2} + \sigma_{i}^{2} + \sigma_{j}^{2})}^{1/2}}(\mu_{i} - \mu_{j})$ for $i,j = 1,...,r$


With thIS exact expression of MISE, we can compute $h_{MISE}$ by minimizing equation (2) numerically:


\begin{align}
h_{MISE} := arg min_{h>0} MISE_{r}[\hat{f}(\cdot;h)]
\end{align}
